comments.body:
Might be worth mentioning that this is always 0 for the leader?

Also, can we document how this is defined for replicas which have never caught up? Do we use Long.MaxValue or something?
If a replica has never caught up, it will return something close to the current time since the caught up time is initialized to zero.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +38,42 @@
    /**
     * The number of milliseconds (if any) since the last time this replica was caught up to the high watermark.
     * For a leader replica, this is always zero.
     */
